page.title: 06Haslington Over the Years.
page.content: From a series of interviews with elderly people of the village a wealth of information was gleaned. Employment has always had to be got outside the survey area,notably in Crewe although the coming of the Milk Marketing Board factory provided some employment for local people. The installation of electricity and erection of electric street lighting had a dramatic effect on the village. The population has grown and subsequently the "neighbourliness" is considered to have declined in the opinions of the older residents. Most of the land 70 years ago,was farmland and cattle used to wander through the village as there was no main road and no traffic.There has been a steady increase in population and the area has become a desirable residential area.
